results.title: Visual perception
results.brief_description: Dr. Hadley Cantrill of Princeton University discusses his investigations of the effects of some of our assumptions on what we see. Shows balloons that seem to move when in reality they are being inflated and deflated, or illuminated and darkened.

results.title: Viskingar och rop = Cries and whispers
results.creator_credit: Cinematograph for Svenska Filminstitutet, Svenska filminstitutet and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description:
Two sisters, Maria and Karin, tend their sister, Agnes, dying of cancer, in the family mansion. Over the course of the film the three sisters and the family maid, Anna, examine their past, lamenting dark and tumultuous moments. Maria is a self-centred, vain, exquisite beauty, with a shallow perspective; Karin, bitter and frigid has a history of self-mutilation and contemplates suicide; Agnes, in immense pain, is comforted by Anna the fatalistic family retainer. Bergman artfully explores the inner life of the women, detailing the history of their connectedness yet isolation from each other. With flashbacks and minimal dialogue Bergman lays out the emotional landscape of this family’s fragile bonds that strain under the imminent death of one. Clocks are a repeated motif for the passage of time, and a reminder of the women’s mortality; sound and colour play an important part in the narrative with red (wine, walls, curtains) representing the soul’s interior. Set in the late 1800s, ‘Cries and Whispers’ is an intense, disturbing and powerful family drama about repression, spirituality, sexual passion, hatred and death.

Credits: Producer, director, writer, Ingmar Bergman ; photography, Sven Nykvist ; editing, Siv Lundgren.
Cast: Harriet Andersson, Kari Sylwan, Ingrid Thulin, Liv Ullmann, Erland Josephson, Henning Moritzen.

results.title: Visitors in time
results.brief_description: Explores the way of life of the inhabitants of the former Portuguese island of Timor in the Malay archipelago. Shows the various ways in which these islanders earn a living, highlights the similarities between an ancient people and their present day descendants.

results.title: Visit to Picasso = Visite a Picasso
results.creator_credit: Paul Haesaerts, Art et Cinema and Jean Van Raemdonck
results.brief_description: A study of the work of Picasso showing the development of his technique from his ‘blue’ period, through Cubism to abstraction. A series of paintings, sculptures and ceramics in the first part of the film lead to a personal interview with the artist in his studio at Vallauris in which he gives an unusual demonstration of his technique by sketching white paint on an invisible sheet of glass placed between himself and the camera. Examples of the artist’s work in the film are from the Musee d’Antibes at Vallauris which is devoted almost entirely to the exhibition of Picasso’s work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Haesaerts, Art et Cinema and Jean Van Raemdonck
